1.「おお <pc>か。| じつはな……。王子は今| 自分の部屋に 閉じこもっておる: Oh, <pc>. As a matter of fact, the|prince's room is locked up right now.

4.「だが 結果は失敗だった……。| 恵みの歌のような効果は 生みだせなかった。: But the result was a failure... it did not|produce the same effect as the Song of Grace.

15.「……よし。読み上げるから| <pc>君も 聞いていてくれ。: ...Okay. I'm going to read it to you, and you|can listen to <pc> too.

17.<center>流れに言葉を乗せてこそ 『歌』となり得る。|ならば 私は その極:
It can only be a "song" when the words are|carried on the stream. If so, then I will|offer my mastery to the Waterfall Queen's|
|feet.

20.「よし！ 清廉の大滝へ 行ってみよう。| 今回は 僕ひとりで やってみる。| <: All right! Let's go to the Great Falls of|Seiren. This time, I'll do it alone. No help|from <pc> this time!

21.「あああっ。お待ちください 王子どの～！: Ahh. Please wait, Your Royal Highness~!

22.「行ってしまわれた……であります。: I am sorry to say that he has gone....

24.「どうも 引っかかるのでありますよ。| くわしい話を 聞いていただきたいので|: I'm a little stuck on this one. We would like|you to come to our research office for a more|detailed discussion.

25.「<pc>。なにやら オーディスが| ひとりで 出かけていったようだが。| どこ: <pc>. Something about Odis going off|on his own. Do you know where he went?

26.「ふむ……。王の石版には 隠された文字が| あったというのか。瀑布の女王……。|: Hmmm... the King's Tablet has a hidden|message. Waterfall Queen... you went to the|Great Falls of Innocence.

The Great Falls of Innocence is not a place|for a person to approach. I don't think even|King Ladis would be able to hide something|
|from you.

I assume that the investigative team is|continuing their investigation? Then tag-team|with them this time and follow up with the|
|prince .

29.「それにしても 瀑布の女王とは| かっこいい異名も あったものだ。| ワシも そ: But still, Waterfall Queen is such a cool|nickname. I wish I had such a nickname.

30.「おお <pc>か。| 調査団と 話はしてくれたようだな。: Oh <pc>. I see you've spoken to the|survey team.

31.「<pc>殿には 面倒をかけるが| 調査団の依頼を 果たしてやってほしいのだ。: I know this is a lot of trouble for|<pc>, but I need you to fulfill the|request of the survey team.

33.「心配いらん。<pc>ならば| きっと バッチリと やってくれるだろう。| ワシ: Don't worry. I'm sure <pc> will do a|great job. I know what I'm talking about!

35.「……エリーゴ調査員！| 清廉の大滝からは 何も見つからなかったぞ。: ...Detective Eriego! We didn't find anything|from the Great Falls of Seiren.

36.「失礼ながら 王子どの。| 小生は 瀑布の女王という言葉が 清廉の大滝を| 指し: With all due respect, Your Highness. I did not|mean to imply that the Waterfall Queen refers|to the Great Falls of Seiren.

37.「お引き止めしようとしたときには| すでに 王子どのは 外へ……。: By the time I tried to stop him, the prince|was already outside...

38.「……そうか。僕の勇み足だったというわけか。: I see. So it was my own lack of courage.

39.「いえいえ ご安心ください！！| 我々調査団と <pc>どのの活躍により| 瀑布: No, no, no, don't worry! Thanks to the efforts|of our survey team and <pc>, we have|found the location of the Waterfall Queen!

40.「なに？ すぐに聞かせてくれ！！: What? I need to hear it now!

41.「ふたつ滝の巡礼という ラーディス王の時代の| 巡礼の手引書を 調べたのでありま: I studied a pilgrimage manual from the time of|King Ladis called "The Pilgrimage of the Two|Falls.

42.「その結果 当時の清廉の大滝は 瀑布の王。| ヴァース大山林の東にある滝が 瀑布:

|the Verse Mountain Forest was called the|Waterfall Queen!

44.「……なるほどな。当時は男王が国を治めていた。| だから もっとも大きい清廉の大:
...I see. In those days, a male king ruled the|country. That's why the largest waterfall, the|Great Falls of Qingren, was called the King of|
|the Falls, not the Waterfall Queen.

45.「その後 女王が国を治める時代となり| 清廉の大滝の異名が 変わったんだ……。|:

|about it?

47.「ふむ……。他の滝よりも 大きいな。| この滝が どうやら 瀑布の女王のようだ。: Hmm... it's bigger than the other waterfalls.|This waterfall is apparently the Waterfall|Queen.

48.「……王の石版に書かれていた| 瀑布の女王の足もととは 滝つぼのことを| 指して: ...I think the reference to the Waterfall|Queen's feet on the King's Tablet refers to|the waterfall basin.

49.「清廉の大滝の滝つぼは 入れるような| 場所じゃなかったが ここなら入れる……！: The waterfall basin of the Great Falls of|Seiren was not a place you could enter, but|here you can...!

50.「これは 男の王となるために| 僕自身が やらなければいけないことだ。| <pc: This is what I have to do to become the king|of men. <pc> can wait here.

53.「僕の考えは 正しかったようだ。| さっそく この石版を読んでみよう。: It seems I was right. Let's read this Tablet|right away.

54.<center>私の名は ラーディス。|私が生きた この時代は|闇の時代と言えよ: My name is Ladis. This age in which I live can|be called the age of darkness.

55.<center>暴君と呼ばれし魔物が 破壊の限りを尽くし|我がウェディの民は|滅: The monster known as the Tyrant was about to|wreak havoc and bring ruin upon my people in|Weddie.

58.「あの時は 母上たちの歌による協力があった。| 完全な状態のバサグランデが| ど: At that time, we had the help of our mothers|in singing. One can only imagine how much of a|threat a fully intact Bogan would have been.

60.<center>私の誓いを破り 男の王を目指す者よ。|よくぞ ここまで たどりつ: You who break my oath and aspire to be king of|men. I am proud of you for having made it this|far.
